definition: to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
What's (he) up to?/What's the motive behind all this?

sentences.english: That teacher told my sister , don't learn much more English!
sentences.chinese: 记住不要再像我妹妹一样被一些居心叵测的人利用。

sentences.english: It even proscribed the deliberate cultivation oflascivious thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至犯禁居心栽培的设法。

sentences.english: This manoeuvre of his is a diabolical conspiracy.
sentences.chinese: 他这一手是一个居心叵测的大阴谋。

sentences.english: We threw a look of contempt at him because he told a deliberate lie.
sentences.chinese: 果为他居心说谎，所以我们对他投以藐视的目光。

sentences.english: The snake is up to no good.
sentences.chinese: 这条蛇真是居心叵测啊。

sentences.english: What would the North expect to do by heightening the tension on the Korean Peninsula?
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜加剧朝鲜半岛紧张，它居心何在？

sentences.english: To sum up: it is meaningful to limit the use of disposloclocated ation plastic.
sentences.chinese: 综上所述，这是居心义的限制一次性塑料的使用。

sentences.english: This maneuver of his is a diabolical conspiracy.
sentences.chinese: 他这一手是一个居心叵测的大阴谋。

sentences.english: Or what great danger dwells upon my suit?
sentences.chinese: 或我的请求竟居心险恶？
存心忍耐的，胜过居心骄傲的。

sentences.english: This self-imitation leads on to deliberate imitation of sounds made to them by other people.
sentences.chinese: 这种自我模拟使他们居心模拟别人对他们措辞的声音。

sentences.english: There's nothing in the world which has more ulterior motives than advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 世界上没有比广告更居心叵测的。

sentences.english: Unless you have ulterior motives, the facts will open your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 除非你居心不良，否则那里的真相会让你大开眼界。

sentences.english: Niger's Information Minister said the UN officials were ill-intentioned.
sentences.chinese: 尼日尔信息部长称，联合国官员居心不良。

sentences.english: Do you think he made that mistake on purpose?
sentences.chinese: 他认为他是居心弄错的吗？

sentences.english: Love the neighbor. But don't get caught .
sentences.chinese: 要居心往爱你的街坊，不外不要让她的老私晓得。

definition: to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
What's (he) up to?/What's the motive behind all this?
to have an axe to grind (idiom)
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
